verses.text: These are the journeys of the Israelites when they went out from the land of Egypt by their divisions under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
verses.comment: Sets up the recounting of their travels. No significant differences.

verses.text: Moses recorded their starting places by the command of the LORD, and these are their journeys according to their starting places.
verses.comment: Notes Moses wrote these stages by God's command.

verses.text: They set out from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month. On the day after the Passover, the Israelites went out boldly in the sight of all the Egyptians.
While the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom the LORD had struck down among them; the LORD also executed judgments against their gods.
verses.comment: References the death of Egypt’s firstborn and judgment on their gods.

verses.text: The Israelites set out from Rameses and camped at Succoth.
They set out from Succoth and camped at Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.
verses.comment: Journey continues, now heading toward wilderness.

verses.text: They set out from Etham and turned back toward Pi-hahiroth, which faces Baal-zephon, and camped near Migdol.
verses.comment: Describes the route before the crossing of the sea.

verses.text: They set out from Pi-hahiroth, passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness, and after traveling three days in the Wilderness of Etham, they camped at Marah.
verses.comment: Covers the Red Sea crossing and arrival at Marah.

verses.text: They set out from Marah and came to Elim; at Elim there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, so they camped there.
verses.comment: Location of abundant water and palm trees.

verses.text: They set out from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
They set out from the Red Sea and camped in the Wilderness of Sin.
verses.comment: Next stop, the Wilderness of Sin.

verses.text: They set out from the Wilderness of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
verses.comment: No direct cross-reference; Dophkah only in this list.

verses.text: They set out from Dophkah and camped at Alush.
They set out from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
They set out from Rephidim and camped in the Wilderness of Sinai.
verses.comment: Arrive at Sinai, site of covenant.

verses.text: They set out from the Wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth-hattaavah.
They set out from Kibroth-hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
They set out from Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
They set out from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon-perez.
They set out from Rimmon-perez and camped at Libnah.
verses.comment: Libnah is recorded here as a stage in the journey.

verses.text: They set out from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
verses.comment: Another stage; name found only here.

verses.text: They set out from Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
They set out from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
verses.comment: Mount Shepher only in this list.

verses.text: They set out from Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
They set out from Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
They set out from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
They set out from Tahath and camped at Terah.
They set out from Terah and camped at Mithkah.
They set out from Mithkah and camped at Hashmonah.
They set out from Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
They set out from Moseroth and camped at Bene-jaakan.
They set out from Bene-jaakan and camped at Hor-haggidgad.
They set out from Hor-haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
They set out from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
They set out from Abronah and camped at Ezion-geber.
verses.comment: Ezion-geber becomes a prominent site later.

verses.text: They set out from Ezion-geber and camped in the Wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.
verses.comment: Arrive at Kadesh, site of key events.

verses.text: They set out from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the edge of the land of Edom.
Aaron the priest went up Mount Hor at the command of the LORD and died there in the fortieth year after the Israelites had come out of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.
verses.comment: Aaron’s death notes the date after Exodus.

verses.text: Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard about the coming of the Israelites.
verses.comment: Reference to the report of Israelites approaching.

verses.text: They set out from Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
They set out from Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
verses.comment: Another stage, only in this list.

verses.text: They set out from Punon and camped at Oboth.
They set out from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim, on the border of Moab.
They set out from Iye-abarim and camped at Dibon-gad.
They set out from Dibon-gad and camped at Almon-diblathaim.
verses.comment: Stage only found here and in parallel lists.

verses.text: They set out from Almon-diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
verses.comment: Mountains of Abarim near Nebo, where Moses will die.

verses.text: They set out from the mountains of Abarim and camped in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho.
They camped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim in the plains of Moab.
verses.comment: Gives the boundaries of their camp in Moab.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho, saying:
verses.comment: Begins the LORD's instructions before entry.

verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you and destroy all their carved images and cast idols, and demolish all their high places.
verses.comment: Direct order to destroy Canaanite religion.

verses.text: And you shall take possession of the land and live in it, for I have given the land to you to possess.
verses.comment: Affirms God's gift of the land.

verses.text: You shall distribute the land by lot according to your families. To the larger tribe you shall give a larger inheritance, and to the smaller tribe a smaller inheritance. Wherever the lot falls for anyone, that shall be his. You shall distribute the land according to the tribes of your fathers.
verses.comment: Explains the process for division by lot.

verses.text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those whom you let remain will be as barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides, and they shall harass you in the land where you live.
And as I thought to do to them, so I will do to you."
verses.comment: Final warning: Israel will face God's wrath if disobedient.
